headline.main: FROM HAVANA.; Arrival of the Quaker City Effect of the Financial Derangement in the United States From Six to Eight Thousand Africans Landed, & c.

docs.lead_paragraph: The U.S. Mail steamer Quaker City, SHUFELDT, Commander, arrived last evening from Havana, after a very boisterous passage, having left there on Sunday last, 25th inst., at 12, noon, in a severe gale from the northeast, which continued (with a very heavy sea) during 48 hours.

headline.main: The Empress Eugenie in England and Scotland.
Return of the Prince of Wales.
REV. DR. CHAPIN'S DISCOURSE. CAUSES FOR THANKFULNESS.

THANKSGIVING DAY IN THE CHURCHES.; DISCOURSES UPON THE PRESENT CRISIS. Causes for Gratitude and Humility. Below we give reports of a large number of discourses delivered in the churches of this City and Brooklyn, yesterday, upon the present political crisis, and the causes we have for thanksgiving and for humiliation and prayer. In almost every instance, the churches were well filled, and in some, only standingroom was to be had. DISCOURSE OF REV. DR. POTTS. THE DUTY OF CONCILIATION.

headline.main: MRS. WINSLOW'S SOOTHING SYRUP FOR CHILDREN TEETHING.; LETTER FROM A MOTHER IN LOWELL, MASS.

docs.lead_paragraph: DEAR SIR: I am happy to be able to certify to the efficiency of MRS. WINSLOW's SOOTHING SYRUP, and to the truth of what it is represented to accomplish. Having a little boy suffering greatly from teething, who could not rest, and at night by his cries would not permit any of the family to do so, I purchased a bottle of the ...
